intro: Stenodraba lagunae, commonly known as the saltbush of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often growing in coastal or saline soils. Its adaptability to harsh conditions makes it an important species in ecological restoration projects. Stenodraba lagunae plays a vital role in stabilizing soils and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
